The FBI is looking at Jared Kushner, President Donald Trump’s son-in-law and an influential White House adviser, as part of its investigation into Russia’s influence in the 2016 election, The Washington Post and NBC News reported Thursday evening.
Kushner met with Kislyak in December and Sergey Gorkov, the head of Vnesheconombank, a state-owned bank, after Trump was elected, at Kislyak’s request.
Sources told the Post that Kushner has come under scrutiny because of two meetings with Russian officials in December ?
Kushner has also voluntarily agreed to meet with the Senate Intelligence Committee to discuss the meetings.
Kushner initially did not disclose the meetings on an application for a security clearance.
one with Russian Ambassador to the U.S. Sergey Kislyak and another with a banker.
His lawyer later acknowledged he had made an error and amended the application.
Kushner has not been accused of wrongdoing, both outlets noted.
